author: Francesco Cardullo
title: Banking The Unbanked
description: 272M migrants around the world sending their hard earn 1.76T USD back home through underground remittance.

assessments.note: I'm not sure what Asdra Token is offering that Ada cannot do with the unbanked project in Africa adapted to Thailand. It feels like a project that has been done and misses the point whilst being overly ambitious for the proposer's capacity.
assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback. The volatility of cryptocurrencies is not ideal to use as a daily remittance. Cryptocurrencies may not work smoothly in countries without an exchanger or stores that accept cryptocurrencies. We intend to remove the technical difficulties to allow acceptance around the world. It would be impossible to require older people to download an app, fill out the KYC, secure the wallet, and transfer and receive cryptocurrencies, let alone the relatively few people without any cryptocurrency knowledge.

assessments.note:
The DApp would have the potential of helping 272M people if successful. 
Great idea to improve on international transactions within a legal framework. The system would be beneficial for the blockchain, both nations between the transactions and above all the users.

I give this proposal a 5 for impact because the application idea aims to bring a high level of value to users in this calendar year. They are developing an IOS application to help migrants send funds home to family members in a user friendly manner (mitigating the confusion around sending cryptos in the current space). This proposal seeks to use crypto to explicitly make the world a better place. My only concern about meeting the goal of the challenge regards profitability. As the proposal states, transaction fees will be "almost zero" so I wonder how app creators will create a profit. But I still give it a 5 even considering that question.

This proposal certainly addresses the challenge and may in fact be a stellar Dapplication. The community senses that this proposal has merit but there are many questions that still remain. I feel this proposal will grow with further collaboration and engagement from the PC community.

This is a well presented plan of creatively named releases but very little energy was spent in explaining actual works that rather generalist and academic team members are planning to undertake on day-to-day basis.
assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback, however please check our paper here: https://docs.asdra.com/, our website, or our documentation on the Cardano Catalyst. We are sure we have described the actual work well. Thank you.

assessments.note:
The team's credentials are highly experienced with ties to the governments in the countries where they want to deploy this first. Given the structure of the roadmap, everything is already planned. 
If they manage to recruit the right developers, it would be likely to succeed.

The feasibility of successfully implementing this project is high. This is not a question of coding, as many applications like this exist. It will be a matter of complying with local laws which is my biggest request to developers to this proposal: provide us in the future more detail of what the AML laws and regulations are in the localities you are seeking to develop in. But I believe the developers should be able to sort through the laws and regulations to ensure the app complies. The other feasibility challenge will be getting users but I do not think that will be difficult so long as the application is built as they outline it and it is aesthetically pleasing.

For this to work it needs the crypto to fiat connections in every country transfers are to happen between. The proposers don't appear to have the experience of connection to achieve this. Evidence of experience or connection in this regard, or even a plan for how they intend to go about it would be required to succeed.
assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback. But it seems that you have overlooked our website and lite paper. The documents submitted describe in detail how our remittance network is structured. They provide an overview of how the employer would pay the employee who is a migrant. How the migrant would complete a transaction with a few clicks and further, how the family would disburse the money through a network of partners with existing e-money licenses combining a p2p network. In addition, Asdra has applied for e-money licenses in Thailand, Cambodia, Myanmar and Laos, allowing migrants to easily transfer their hard-earned money back home.

assessments.note: The experience presented is solid and the plan detailed. There does remain some concerns because of the size of the project and legal considerations that will vary by spatial and temporal considerations. These however, are unavoidable due to the technological age of blockchain rather than flaws in the concept.

I feel this team ought to come back in Phase 03 of their project named - Supernovae starting Q2 2021  to conduct "Smart Contract on Plutus Platform exploration" and collaborate with someone in the community on a specific piece of work for which they require specific support that can be named less abstractly.

Judging from the proposal's comments, the team has worked hard to update the proposal and provide the necessary information. Yet it is missing a definition of success as to how many people it is aiming to reach per milestone.

The ability to audit this project should be straight forward - though the KPIs are not outlined in the proposal - by examining Daily/Monthly Active Users, number of transactions settled on the block chain, comparison of exchange rate data used in the app to rates peers received in another forum, fees saved by users, total annual remittance settled by the app. I also appreciate that the team outlines the risk of bureaucratic delays as that could impact the project.
Without a sound plan on how they are going to achieve fiat conversion, this is a nice idea, but unlikely to succeed.
assessments.reply: Thank you very much for your feedback. However, please refer to our paper here: https://docs.asdra.com/, on our website, or in our documentation at the Cardano Catalyst. We are confident that we have described how we plan to execute the project and be successful with it.

assessments.note: While further information may have assisted the overall quality of the proposal I cannot fault the efforts of the team to provide as much as possible. The enthusiasm is evident as is the daunting nature of the project. I like that the team are going to focus on a single location to begin with as I'm quite sure various iterations of the final design will be required to abide by localisation rules and regulations. If the team can get the first region governance resolved I'm confident they can grow further.

solution: To develop a stable-coin remittance system that provides a smooth user experience, utilizing Blockchain to give financial access to anyone.
experience: Our team consists of Blockchain and Smart Contract development enthusiast. BSc in CS, MBA in Economic and Business Accountant.
